name: Puerto Rican Mondongo
author: Amy
summary: This simple, nourishing stew of tripe and vegetables is found in innumerable variations throughout Latin America and around the Caribbean. On the islands of Aruba and Curaçao, it is known as sopi mondongo. Cooking Puerto Rican food is a bit similar to Island and Spain cuisine; it has a distinctive flavor combined with foreign influences using native seasonings and ingredients. Serve in deep bowls with white rice and avocados.
ingredients: 3 pounds beef tripe, trimmed of fat and cut into cubes
8 ounces sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine tripe and lemon juice in a large bowl
Transfer tripe and lemon juice to a large pot
Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened, about 10 minutes
Cover with 2 quarts beef broth, adding water as needed
Bring to a boil; reduce heat and cook until tender, about 2 hours
Stir remaining beef stock, cassava, potatoes, yams, pumpkin, sweet potatoes, tomato sauce, sofrito, and corn into the pot
Cook until tender, about 20 minutes more
